posts.content:
TWF and qualifying for SD takes 5 pre epic feats. You end up in a squeeze where the build only has 3 more pre epic feat slots. I'd like to see Blind fight a lot earlier.
Maybe you will explain why you take Silent spell over extend?

STR - 10
DEX - 15 (26)
CON - 12
WIS - 15 (18)
INT - 14
CHA - 10
This is wrong: You only take 3 Great dexterity feats, ending with dex 25 and trying to take Epic dodge when dex is 24

DEX - 16 (28)

Playing half elf for RP reasons is tough, giving away 1 feat and 1 skill with almost no compensation. If you are so inclined I would suggest roleplaying a 1/4 elf (one elven grandparent) and keep the human avatar.

Now, what skills do you have in mind for the build?

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I'd like to add to what Mick has already pointed out the fact that anything higher than SD 1 is a waste of levels.

Everything that SD gives you, Rogue does too, except for HiPS, which by default comes at level 1. So my question is, why more SD? Is there a level restriction of some sort in your server where you must take at least 5 levels of each class?

I know you don't like negative values in your stats, but you're unnecessarily thinning the build's important stats. You can argue that the strength of your character comes from his god and get it down to 8, since Divine Power will make it 18 regardless. You gotta remember that Clerics already have to divide stat points between two stats (Wisdom and either DEX or STR). I'd advise you to go 8 STR and 8 CHA and just find some RP justification.

To me, this build, although great for Dual Wielding because of Sneaks AND Cleric buffs, is already too feat-starved to take these feats without severely hampering your other combat abilities. How will you generate sneaks without KD / IKD? What good are all these d6 SA damage if you hardly ever get to apply them? You will attack out of hiding, which is nice, but once the opponent engages, you won't be Sneaking them anymore. Now, if you attack out of hiding with KD, that's a whole different story.

I'd change much in that build. Here's what I'd do.

1- Rework the starting stats, try to pump up your DEX a bit as per Mick's suggestion.
2- Get rid of all SD levels for 2 Rogue and the rest Cleric. You gain an extra Rogue Bonus Feat at Rogue 19, 1d6 more Sneak Attack damage, may lose a few skill points, but you'll get the ability to cast level 9 spells. They aren't that great without high Wisdom, but still better than nothing. This would make the build Cleric 20 / Rogue 19 / SD 1. Another alternative is Cleric 15 Rogue 24 SD 1, which would give you another extra feat and more Sneaks, Skill points, but you'd be way more dispellable and your buffs wouldn't last as long.
3- Take KD / IKD and Extend Spell instead of the dual-wielding feats. There just isn't any room for them. They'd be nice to have.
4- Delay Weapon Focus to level 18. NO 15-LEVEL CLERIC needs +1 AB at that stage. EVER! It's only good as a requirement for EWF in epics, so delay it as much as you can.
5- Take Extend Spell at level 6, after Weapon Finesse.
6- If you can't find room for Blind Fight, drop Silent Spell for it. You're a meleer / Flanker, not a caster, and with your bad Wisdom score, you'll make much use of BF than of Silent Spell.

At first glance, this is what I'd change. You could also stop your DEX advancement at 26, since 25 is the requirement for Epic Dodge anyway. That would give you 2 feats, with 1 more you could take the dual-wielding feats after all. Think about it at least, but don't drop Blind Fight.

One more thing: The Naked AC is wrong, 10 is impossible! You MUST take Tumble as a class skill, with your DEX you have AT LEAST 27 AC (8 from Tumble, 9 from DEX modifier, as per Mick's suggestion, otherwise 8 if you choose to leave DEX at 26 as I suggested above).

Since we're at it, there's one more guide you gotta read, which is my Complete Guide to the Basics of Building. It'll help you calculate your stats correctly and allocate skill points.

Also, take a look at this build: The Shadow Priest

Take it EZ!

Thanks for your comments guys, your help is greatly appreciated.
